image.altText: A run down brick property, with a rusty roof

props.synopsis: A run-down convict building was bequeathed to Tasmania's Heritage Council. Following the council's decision to pass on the property, it was snapped up by the then-deputy chair — now an investigation is underway.

title.children: A deceased estate tried to donate this derelict convict building. Its purchase has triggered an investigation

image.altText: Guest facilities at the St Pancras Renaissance Hotel London.

props.synopsis: Staff from a Tasmanian agency charged with "attracting investment" to the state have racked up international hotel stays and other expenses amounting to $289,000 over the past three financial years.

title.children: Five-star hotel stays detailed in spending records of Tasmania's investment advocate and staff

image.altText: A shopfront with flowers for sale

props.synopsis: Cost of living pressures are being felt right across the world, and Australia is no different. But how do the cost of our groceries actually compare?

title.children: Grocery prices compared between Australia, UK, NZ and Ireland — who comes out on top?

image.altText: Stock image of a Virgin plane

props.synopsis: Qatar Airways will buy a 25 per cent stake in Virgin Australia after an agreement was reached between the Australian airline's owner, Bain Capital, and the Gulf carrier.

title.children: Virgin Australia hopes to expand international flight offerings after Qatar Airways agrees to buy 25pc stake

image.altText: A generic composit image of a transmission tower and a smart meter.

props.synopsis: A simmering row between electricity retailers and poles-and-wires companies boils over amid claims consumers are being hurt by "perverse" complex prices.

title.children: Electricity industry at war with itself as retailers unload on 'perverse, impossible' tariffs

image.altText: A cloud of smoke covers several buildings.

props.synopsis: Huge consecutive blasts have been heard across the Lebanese capital overnight, local time. Follow live.

title.children: Huge blasts heard in Lebanese capital as Israeli ground invasion appears imminent

image.altText: A yellow Hezbollah flag, featuring an arm reaching up to a rifle, seen above a sea of people.

props.synopsis: Federal police are investigating a Melbourne protest where Hezbollah flags were displayed in what shapes as an early test of hate-symbol laws passed earlier this year.

title.children: Hezbollah flags at protests shape as test of new hate-symbol laws

image.altText: A man and woman stand side-by-side, smiling.

props.synopsis: No puppies, mandatory medical examinations and hard-to-understand financial consequences. Welcome to life inside some of Australia's retirement villages.

title.children: No puppies, no long-term visitors, mandatory medical examinations: Retirement village contracts exposed

image.altText: Long Walk 2024-09-27

props.synopsis: Every work day, Hui Shan steels herself for the 'long walk' to her office. It's only a few hundred metres — but the threat of racist abuse makes it seem a much longer journey.

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 Hui Shan's walk to work is only a few hundred metres — but the racist abuse makes it seem much longer

image.altText: Numerous large tanks seen in an open area

props.synopsis: IDF officials say targeted raids against Hezbollah are being conducted in the border area of Lebanon and Israel.

title.children: Israeli tanks amass near border as defence minister confirms limited ground operations

image.altText: A man wearing shorts and sneakers wheeling a suitcase behind him.

props.synopsis: In August, New Zealand's central bank suddenly had to begin cutting as the economy plunged into recession. Many global counterparts have begun asking: Could we be next?

title.children: The great Kiwi rate hike experiment and where it all went wrong

image.altText: Separate close-up headshots of Tim Walz and JD Vance.

props.synopsis: Tim Walz and JD Vance haven't spent much time on the national stage – so a lot of Americans don't know too much about them. The debate is one of their best shots to win over voters in an election race that remains tight.

title.children: Vice-presidential candidates Tim Walz and JD Vance are preparing to debate. Here's what to watch for

image.altText: A plane sits on the runway at an airport. It is white with purple highlights and the word Bonza on the side.

props.synopsis: Investigators are examining why some money destined for a private investment firm's football teams instead went to Bonza. The airline collapsed barely a year after it launched.

title.children: US authorities investigating whether budget airline Bonza was funded with money meant for football teams

image.altText: Two chickens stand beside a red bowl.

props.synopsis: Two million Australian chickens have already been killed in the nation's bird flu outbreak — and that's before the deadliest strain of the virus hits our shores.

title.children: 'The ramifications are huge': Why scientists fear havoc when H5N1 bird flu strain reaches Australia

image.altText: A large white house with a "for sale" sign in front of it.

props.synopsis: National home prices rose in September, new data shows, but some of the heat continues to come out of the housing market as more owner-occupiers and investors consider selling.

title.children: With 'borrowing capacity still pretty constrained', house price rises continue but at a slower pace

image.altText: Coles and Woolworths branding outside neighbouring supermarkets

props.synopsis: Federal and state treasurers will meet to change planning and zoning laws to end alleged "land banking" by the supermarket giants, where property is purchased and sat on to prevent competitors from entering.

title.children: Coles and Woolworths's alleged land hoarding comes under the microscope, as treasurers seek zoning law changes

image.altText: Aerial shot of a grey SUV driving on an unmarked road through vast field of drown and green grass.

props.synopsis: Some manufacturers said we'd be in self-driving cars by now and that hasn't quite played out. So where do driverless, hydrogen and electric vehicles fit in Australia's driving future?

title.children: Why Australia is so far behind other nations in EV sales, and how utes are part of the problem

image.altText: A Brisbane Broncos NRL coach stands smiling on a football field holding a ball with posts in the far background.

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Broncos confirm NSW State of Origin-winning coach Michael Maguire is taking the job at Red Hill, replacing the sacked Kevin Walters.

title.children: Michael Maguire's hunger for premiership spurs Broncos tilt as Blues coach heads north

image.altText: Young woman smiling with sky, clouds and Nepal mountain in background

props.synopsis: Legal changes introduced in the wake of the September 11 attacks, which only took effect in 2022, mean that unless there are exceptional circumstances Australians are now limited to three name changes in a lifetime.

title.children: Anti-terrorism law change traps woman with 'hippie whim' name she doesn't use or want

image.altText: A serious man and a woman stand in field of crops, man, wears cap, looks down, woman looks away, blue sky, trees.

props.synopsis: Fiona and Rob Duff say rejecting the potential cash flow from wind turbines is not an ideological decision about climate change or energy.

title.children: This couple could have made millions from renewables, but one major issue stopped them

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The flagship ASX 200 index remains near record highs as the market waits on retail and construction data that will shed light on consumption and confidence. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX 200 near record highs as data set to shed light on consumption and confidence

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ACCC will 'consider the impact on competition' with Qatar/Virgin deal

image.altText: Debris is seen in the aftermath of Hurricane Helene

props.synopsis: It was one of the worst storms in US history, and a clearer picture of the damage is now emerging, with about 600 people believed to be missing.

title.children: Hurricane Helene death toll rises to over 120 across six south-eastern US states

image.altText: Xi Jinping gives a little wave next to a Chinese flag

props.synopsis: The bursting of China's economic bubble has exposed deep vulnerabilities in the Chinese Communist Party  — and threatens Xi Jinping's legacy.

title.children: 75 years of the People's Republic of China and Xi's rule is at a crossroads

image.altText: A woman's hands hold a smartphone in shadow.

props.synopsis: Tinder, Hinge and other online dating platforms will have six months to become compliant with a code of conduct designed to make the matchmaker apps safer, after years of reported failures to act on sexual assaults enabled by their platforms.

title.children: Dating code will require Tinder, Hinge to act on dangerous users, cooperate with law enforcement

image.altText: A man in a suit sits on a leather lounge, looking professional.

props.synopsis: The special envoy to combat Islamophobia, Aftab Malik, has been appointed by the federal government, months after it named Australia's first anti-Semitism envoy.

title.children: Islamophobia envoy Aftab Malik appointed after months of delay

image.altText: A drone shot of Tuvalu.

props.synopsis: As rising tides grip Tuvalu, many citizens are considering migration. But what will life look like for those who chose to stay?

title.children: Tuvaluans determined to stay put are fighting to save their island nation

image.altText: A blue sky, many mountain peaks and a river in the foreground,

props.synopsis: Rising a couple of millimetres per year on average, Mt Everest is having a growth spurt. A new study suggests that a "pirated" river thousands of years ago might have given it a boost.

title.children: Why is Mt Everest growing twice as quickly as expected?

image.altText: Two men stand with their arms around each other holding a beer.

props.synopsis: Lochie Jacobs, 18, and Joey Urban, 19, were killed in Friday's crash and are being remembered for their vibrant personalities.

title.children: Driver charged over Dubbo crash that claimed the lives of two young mates and a couple

image.altText: Firefighters in Tara rushing to help extinguish a blaze.

props.synopsis: As large parts of Queensland brace for bushfire season, a state government review has been told woefully inadequate phone service in some regional areas poses a "direct threat to public safety".

title.children: Poor phone service and confusing warnings are risking lives during fires, floods and cyclones, review told

image.altText: Steven Miles and other politicians smile for the camera.

props.synopsis: The Queensland election campaign starts today ahead of voting on October 26. Follow live.

title.children: 'Battlelines' drawn in Queensland election as politicians target regional electorates

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Meghan Scanlon will face a tough fight to retain her seat
'The battlelines have been drawn': Crisafulli speaks from Bundaberg

image.altText: A digger is working on a block of land behind a 'For Sale' sign. The sign has a 'Sold' sticker on it.

props.synopsis: The NT government's new housing incentive program includes three different grants ranging from $10,000 to $50,000, encompassing both first home buyers and existing home owners.

title.children: Australia's most generous housing grant scheme opens in the NT today. Here's what's on offer

image.altText: A illustrated image of a woman holding a phone looking out a window

props.synopsis: What happens when victims of domestic violence are too intimidated to expose their perpetrator? Take a look inside the covert system led by social workers across New South Wales.

title.children: One frightening number shows the true extent of domestic violence

image.altText: A young woman with curly dark hair, wearing a grey jumper, smiling inside a brightly lit restaurant.

props.synopsis: Madeleine Burgess says she's spent the majority of her life "feeling really unfeminine". Diagnosed with PCOS in her early teens, she says managing excess hair growth, a common symptom, is expensive and embarrassing.

title.children: The PCOS symptom burdening time, wallets and wellbeing

image.altText: An image of a teenager's hand holding a vape.

props.synopsis: Australians aged 18 and over looking to buy a vape without a prescription can now do so legally under changes to national vaping legislation that come into effect today.

title.children: Changes to Australia's vaping laws begin today. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: a young man with a moustache and dark hair walks with his head slightly down

props.synopsis: A magistrate says 26-year-old Lachlan Morganti infringed on Hannah McGuire's relatives' grieving and betrayed the trust and generosity of a community.

title.children: Court spares gambler jail for stealing donations from alleged Ballarat murder victim's family
